result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Lynn Kuklinski

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

8:33 AM Defendant Amy Lynn Kuklinski in court.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Amy Lynn Kuklinski. 
Cases 21CF518 and 22CF72
State will be filing an amended information on 21CF518 it will amend count 1 and add a count 2.
Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CF518 Count 1 - No Contest
21CF518 Count 2 - No Contest

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 21CF518 Counts 1 & 2.
22CF72 is dismissed and read in.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
ADA Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Soule concurs with the joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT: 
21CF518 Count 1
Serve 120 days in jail. 
 zero days credit.
Huber for work, counseling, and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
- STAYED - 

Placed on probation for a period of  24 months.
Early Discharge after 18 months, if recommended by the Agent.
Conditions of Probation: 
-No direct or indirect contact with the victim.
-Maintain full-time employment, full-time schooling or a combination of both for full-time. 
-Comply with other assessments deemed appropriate by DOC or by Agent. 
-Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge. 
-Pay $250 fine + costs + surcharges.

21CF518 Count 2
Serve 120 days in jail, concurrent with Count 1. 
Early Discharge after 18 months, if recommended by the Agent.
Same conditions as Count 1.
 - STAYED - 

Probation 24 months
Comply with conditions as set forth in Count 1.
Pay $250 fine + costs + surcharges.

20 days to appeal.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered to all cases.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

4:16 PM Defendant Amy Lynn Kuklinski appeared in court, Attorney Taylor O Soule for Amy Lynn Kuklinski appeared in court, Attorney Kelly A Cassidy for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 

Both files heard: 21CF518, 22CF72

21CF518 Preliminary Hearing conducted: 

Detective K. Flick is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Cassidy. 
Cross exam by Atty Soule. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

22CF72:  Preliminary Hearing conducted: 

Deputy B. Mathwich is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Cassidy. 
Cross exam by Atty Soule. 

Atty Cassidy asks the court to take judicial notice of  21CF518 and the bond in that file. 
Court takes note. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:07 PM Defendant Amy Lynn Kuklinski appeared in court, Attorney Anne Renc for Amy Lynn Kuklinski appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for March 14, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1
